subsections.title: Definition
subsections.content: Businesses are classified by ownership and size.
points: Sole trader: Owned and operated by one person.
Corporation: Owned by shareholders; managed by directors.
Cooperatives: Owned and controlled by members for mutual benefit.

subsections.title: Advantages and Disadvantages
subsections.content: Each business type has its own strengths and weaknesses.
points: Sole trader: Easy to start, but unlimited liability.
Partnership: Shared responsibilities, but conflicts may arise.
Corporation: Limited liability, but complex setup.

subsections.title: Definition
subsections.content: Entrepreneurship involves starting and running a business.
points: They combine resources to produce goods or services.

subsections.title: Stages in Entrepreneurship
subsections.content: The process of turning an idea into a functioning business.

subsections.title: Definition
subsections.content: Marketing is promoting and selling products to customers.
points: It involves understanding customer needs and delivering value.

subsections.title: The 4 Ps of Marketing
subsections.content: Also known as the Marketing Mix.
points: Product: The item or service offered.
Price: The cost to the customer.
Place: Where and how the product is sold.
Promotion: Methods used to inform and persuade customers.

subsections.title: Importance of Marketing
subsections.content: Effective marketing helps businesses grow and compete.
